data.title: Always on the lookout for good Indian
data.text: We are always up for Indian Food and this was pretty good. We went with another couple so we ordered intending to share but it always seems my choice becomes the favorite and I end up with a small portion! But it was all good. Service was excellent and they bent over backwards to accommodate.

data.title: yearning for some good Indian Food
data.text:
We usually order take out here because it is so good. However, tonight we want to go out and enjoy a meal. We were greeted at the door and guided to a table. Service was impeccable. Polite. NOT obsequies in the least. The menu is varied and each dish I have had here tempts your taste buds. 
The rice is always perfect. We had Onion Bhajia and Vegetable Pakora's for appetizers and then my husband had Lamb Saag and I had Lamb Jafreezi both excellent and the rice cooked to perfection.
They didn't have the wine I selected however, they brought me a different one to taste that was quite nice. 
We will definitely go back again ...whether it is to take out or eat in...doesn't matter always delicious.

data.title: Hidden Treasure
data.text: This some of the best Indian food I have ever experenced. It is a small unassuming restaurant.  I ordered take out since I needed to be home soon. Thar food was prepared fresh with tender meat. The spices we perfect. I can't wait to visit the again. Try it you will love it.

data.title: Great Food, Great People
data.text: The food is always amazing and the customer service is very good! I've been waited on by one of the owners many times and he's always offering ideas for new things to try and sometimes even offers up off-menu meals.

data.title: Good Food, but way too SPICY
data.text: We always like going to have good Indian food nearby. Usually we go when we are really craving it. The vegetable korma and chicken tikka masula is good, however everytime my mom has eaten there she gets sick due to it being too SPICY. I would have given this place 4 stars because the food is good. Just can't get sick off of it.

data.title: Really good indian
data.text: The buffet is good, they keep it freshly stocked, the entrees on the menu are good, love the chicken masala and they have good naan. Love this place, park in back.

data.title: Authentic Cuisine, Will Return
data.text: This was very excellent Indian cuisine. I took my brother and boyfriend here for dinner last week. We shared the Chicken Tikka Masala and a few vegetarian dishes. The food was excellent; though the prices did seem a little steep. I can't imagine a bad dish being served here. The restaurant was very clean and beautifully decorated. I loved the ambiance. I'm curious to try the buffet and will definitely be returning soon!

data.title: So good, that it ruined me for other restaurants
data.text:
First off, I love spicy and flavorful Eastern dishes.  I'm not into bland, all white meat, zero personality American food with no history or prep time required for proper integration of complex flavors and spices.  Having said that, this place is the real deal.  If you don't want your food to make you sweat, they will make it just right for you. If, like me, you do want some heat, they can make your dish one of 4 levels of heat.  I have been to Indian restaurants in many cities across the country, and they all pale in comparison. 
 Heck, I order things that aren't even on the menu here, sometimes.  If the service isn't as fast as Applebees or Fridays, that's because quality takes time, and it's just a family affair here.  It's not just a meal, it's an experience, if you allow it to be. 
Cheers

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: Went here for dinner with a friend on a Tuesday. Was looking for somewhere where we could talk and take our time, instead of the usual brewery dinners that we have. This place was perfect. Calm atmosphere, attentive staff, wonderful food. Prices are reasonable. Started with the hot tea and ordered a few different items - shared family style with fresh naan. All of it was wonderful!! Will definitely eat here again!

data.title: Slipping a bit...
data.text: Had not been there for a year until a recent business lunch. Seems like the quality and selection in the buffet has slipped a bit.  The mango lasse was on the path to fermentation, and the keer was thin. The chicken tika masala was missing spice and the chicken was dry. The meatball dish lacked heat or spice. The naan was 4 halves and good. It was $33 out the door for  lunch for two people with non-bar beverages.

data.title: Food was delicious, service a bit slow
data.text: The food was delicious and authentic. The staff was very friendly but service seemed a bit slow when it appeared to not be very busy. Maybe we just caught them low on staff that night. Based on the flavor and quality of the food, I would definitely go back.

data.title: Love their Peas Pilau!
data.text: Love the food at Flavor of India.  Have only eaten there a couple of times but have gotten carry-out many times.  I LOVE their Peas Pilau (basmati rice with cashews, peanuts, almonds, raisins & peas).  My favorite dish is Chicken Tika Masala!

data.title: Excellent Indian Food!!!
data.text: Great Indian dishes - favorite in Longmont and other places! Great service and atmosphere. Good variety of dishes and great flavor - you can select how spicy you want it to be.

data.title: Best Indian food in Boulder County
data.text: We love Flavor of India.  The staff is friendly and very professional and responsive.  The food is outstanding.  My favorite is their Chicken Vindaloo, although you really can't go wrong with any of their dishes.

data.title: No class service
data.text: Most buffets stop seating at their stated closing time but allow the already seated patrons to enjoy finishing their meals. Not this crew. They started breaking down the buffet and VACUUMING while there were still several occupied tables. Average Indian food served with no class!

data.title: We love this place
data.text:
We enjoy the food here. We have only done the buffet but have eaten here several times and the food is very flavorful. 
The service is good. I love their iced tea, it is made with different spices. I have not been able to find anywhere else that makes it.

data.title: Good food. Really REALLY poor customer service.
data.text:
Ah! What to say -- would be a far better place if the owner (manager?) wasn't there. The waitress was quite enthusiastic and pleasant. It was only her 2nd day though. I ordered Shahi Panner and Channa Masala. She misspelled one of my orders so the owner/manager came back to reconfirm it. When I did -- somehow he decided to slash off Shahi Paneer from my order and I only got Channa Masala. Not a problem, I asked for it again and it was out fairly quickly. The portions are much smaller than usual and my Shahi panner had too many Paneer cubes and very little sauce, probably because it was made in a hurry. No problems still. Flavors are really good. Beware of too much cilantro though. 
At the end of the meal I had too many Paneer cubes left so I asked the waitress if I could get a little more sauce to go. She said "sure" -- she spoke too soon. About 10 minutes later, she came back and the owner/manager had asked her to charge us extra for the sauce which she didn't realize. Even though you are not honoring the word, at least come and clarify it first.

data.title: we were a bother to the staff
data.text: We had been coming to Flavor of India for the past few years before attending the Longmont Theater. On our last three (or four) visits we all got cold food, stale food, unpleasant waitress and a feeling we were not really welcome. We typically have a group of 15-18 people, we call FAR ahead, and we dine early. Used to be a great place now its just not. We have moved our business elsewhere.

data.title: Great Indian food
data.text:
Longmont has a jewel with the Taste of India.  The flavor of the dishes are each distinct and wonderful.  The dishes can be made to the desired Desired amount of heat you want, all the way to "Indian Hot"! Which is perfect.
Wonderful staff

data.title: India Delight
data.text: Not much to look at from the outside - inside was bit run down and warn. Waitress was friendly and recommended a good Indian beer. The food was okay, not to hot or spicy. I had a shrimp dish covered with some type of orange-colored paste - weird and way too overlooked. Pretty extensive menu!
